job_description: Co-op Student Position: 4 or 8 months starting in May 2015Co-op Applications Engineer – IPD 7x50 TEC                       No. of openings: 2This position is limited to students that are registered in a recognized Co-Op or Intern Program at a Canadian College or UniversityAn IPD 7x50 applications engineer is a technical expert on the Alcatel-Lucent 7x50 series of routers. The key responsibilities of a TEC engineer include interfacing with internal Alcatel-lucent R&D teams across the globe and customers to solve complex problems, debug installations and apply both established procedures and creative alternatives to solve problems. Other responsibilities include participating in new product intorduction (NPI) and network design activities by offering technical insights; leveraging the knowledge and expertise cultivated in the TEC team.A TEC engineer can confidently represent and speak on behalf of the product and an ideal candidate for this position is one who has stong problem solving and interpersonal skills.Job description:As a co-op student in the TEC team, you will be a part of a dynamic team environment; presented with new and exciting challenges every day! A key responsibility is to provide support to assist one the TEC team members in problem solving activities with customers and internal Alcatel-Lucent teams. This will require:• Basic knowledge of IP / Networking knowledge• The ability to work under pressure to meet customer deadlines• Thinking outside the box and developing creative solutions to complex problemsYou will also have exposure to hardware failure analysis, enterprise customers and the dynamics of large-scale IP/MPLS, IPTV, 4G LTE network deployments.
